column4: someone must know how to find out which foo2 driver is being used by a printer??
most new distro use cups (its the evolution of old bsd system)
do you know anything about how I can tell if it's using foo2zjs? I don't know where to tell it which driver to use
it's a network one (plugs straight in) - th eIP is 192.168.1.250 - I have no idea of the port number
what i told you is the cups manager :)
that will help you manage your printers and stuff.
ok... seems to have the same info as the printer config tool
look at what printer driver says
you can : modify printer or set printer options
it seems to have some good help on network printers, how to test the connection which I think is the issue :)
just print a test page if its print its not connection issue
that's the whole problem, I can't print a test page... I think the printer is set up ok because I used the PPD file, but it can't seem to connect to it

The page http://localhost:631/help/network.html#TABLE1 seems to be some help, I changed the device URI from socket:// to lpd:// (It's a QMS printer)... does the /ps on th eend mean to include exactly that?
